resources.string: AlMasmak palace locate in the heart of Riyadh city was transformed into a museum that contains many halls displaying paintings that include pictures and maps illustrating the epic battles to recapture Riyadh and tells the story of uniting the Kingdom under the leadership of King Abdul Aziz may he rest in peace. It also contains a number of weapons used during those times such as shotguns and swords. The museums also displays pictures and illustrations about modern development in all sectors in the Kingdom.\n\n Address: Riyadh, The Deputy Ministry of Antiquities and Museums. Tel. 4110091. Fax: 4041391.

This palace was built by King AbdulAziz outside the walls of old Riyadh. His majesty used it as his private residence and to conduct formal duties during the evenings.\n\n Address: King AbdulAziz Darah, King AbdulAziz Historical Center P.O. box: 2945, Riyadh. Tel. 4011999. Fax: 4013597.

A unique collection of manuscripts, documents, money notes and rare books in addition to clay pieces and tomb stones and engravings. All these display items illustrate the development of Arabic calligraphy as well as the tools and substances used for this art form.\n\n Address: King Fahad National Library P.O. Box: 7275, Riyadh, 1472. Tel. 4646212.

Some machines and scientific ideas in physics, biology, astronomy, and other scientific fields. A live experiment for static electricity. Astronomical dome show.\n\n Address: Arriyadh Development Authority- Projects and Planning Center Tel. & fax: 4828276

A collection of rare currencies dating back to pre-Islamic eras and a collection of some Islamic coins that were used until the 14th century Hijra. The Museums also displays some samples of GCC and currency and other countries around the world.\n\n Address: Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency (SAMA)- Main center P.O. Box: 6992, Riyadh, 11169. Tel. & fax: 4662100.
